results.title: Robert Klippel drawings, 1947-1963
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description: A succession of the drawings of the Australian sculptor, Robert Klippel, covering the period from 1947-1963. Shows the development of the creative talent - an exploration of the mind of a fascinating man, the things which inspired him and the many strange, abstract drawings which were the result of his experiences in Australia and overseas. The commentary is by Klippel himself. Music by Larry Sitsky.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films

results.title: Robert Frost: a first acquaintance
results.creator_credit: Harold Mantell and Films for the Humanities
results.brief_description: Describes how the poems which first made American poet Robert Frost famous were based on his experiences as a farmer in New England. Shows Frost reading his poems to a student audience, and his daughter, Lesley Frost, discussing some of Frost’s poems and his poetic theories. Suitable for middle and upper seconday levels.

results.title: Robert Browning: his life and poetry
results.brief_description: Surveys the biography and works of the Victorian poet Robert Browning, focussing on the revelation of dramatic monologue. The film shows the things from which Browning drew his inspiration and uses paintings, early photographs and scenes of unchanged parts of London and Italy to illustrate the events of his life. Selections of his poetry are read by constumed actors, emphasising the drama and psychological insight of his work. Narrated by Andrew Faulds.

results.title: Roadworks
results.brief_description: Works on roads and bridges as carried out by the Country Roads Board in all parts of Victoria. Among these shown are the widening of old roads and bridges; testing local materials in field laboratories; experimental lengths of road surfaces; erecting an emergency Bailey bridge after the collapse of an old bridge; eliminating road/rail intersections (the Clifton Hill overpass); and redesigning major intersections for safe traffic flow.

results.title: Roadcraft
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Australian mime and comic Jean-Paul Bell features in this light-hearted filmic look at a serious subject: how to drive in order to prevent collisions. This film is aimed at the more experienced driver as well as the novice. Narrated by Graeme Blundell.

results.title: Road transport trends
results.creator_credit: Jim Stirling and Country Roads Board
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the growing importance and use of Victoria’s roads by transports and by private motorists. Shows the assistance given to designers of motor vehicles in estimating probable load capacity by the Country Roads Board. Explains the careful control of over-dimensional loads for which 15,000 permits are needed annually and show the detailed planning needed for safe and convenient handling of such loads as mobile cranes, houses and earth-moving equipment for which escorts, special equipment and timing is needed.

results.title: Road to security
results.creator_credit: Roy A. Driver and Herschells Films
results.brief_description: Outlines briefly the history and general principles of insurance and shows the work of insurance companies in accepting risks and providing security against fire, accidents, personal injury, marine and general property loss.
